description.raw:
To better illustrate the challenges of physics parameter tuning, I increased the lateral gravity in the example from 1.0 to 3.0 m/s^2, which causes the system to diverge with 70 iterations, though it is stable with 200 iterations. I also added a profile with 500 iterations and a plot of the pitch and yaw angles of each link (which should be zero with a perfect solver) to illustrate the difference in accuracy when using more iterations. It's plain to see when the simulation is diverging, but it can be hard to discern visually the advantage of 200 versus 500 iterations.

I also fixed the coordinate labels in the text and the svg figure.
